abstracts.cdata!:
The Antalya Water Supply And Sanitation
            Project had an unsatisfactory outcome with likely
            sustainability and a modest institutional development
            impact.  Both the Bank and the Borrower performed
            satisfactorily.  The project generally accomplished more
            than what had been planned in terms of physical quantities
            with the exception of the water supply component.. Lessons
            learned included the following: (a) The risk analysis and
            allocation of private operator contracts in the water supply
            and sanitation sector must be improved. (b) Projects must be
            affordable - this project was too big, leading to financial
            difficulties, and it would have been better implemented in
            stages. (c) Projects should have limited objectives -  the
            five objectives made implementation difficult.  (d)
            Selection criteria in private sector participation must be
            carefully analyzed. (e) Local utilities may be unable to
            bear the exchange rate risk where there is a high risk of
            devaluation and where the revenue is in local currency but
            debt service is in foreign exchange.
